page.title: 10Clubs in Flintham.
page.content: The{WI}has been in existence since 1929. In November 1985 it's name was officially changed to{Flintham and {Syerston WI}to recognise the growing ties between the 2 villages. Having gone through a stagnant patch the WI has modernised it's outlook and so attracted more younger members. {The Scout Group}now 10 years old meets weekly in the Old Reading Room and has recently started a Beavers group. The Scouts organise an annual Bonfire Party for the village. There are{football and cricket}teams- most members live in Newark but have had links with Flintham in the past. There is no{Youth Club}at the moment, the teenagers meet nightly in the bus shelter! A{Mother and Toddlers' Group}meets weekly but may soon have to close due to lack of demand!
